perturbation.original_text: Referral Fees will be paid within thirty (30) days of the collection of receivables from the Registered Referral.
perturbation.changed_text: Referral Fees will be paid within sixty (60) days of the collection of receivables from the Registered Referral.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in payment terms. Section 6 now states referral fees are paid within 60 days, while Exhibit B outlines a 30-day payment timeframe creating uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text: For a registered referral where the customer purchases directly from Company or another channel/contract vehicle other than Reseller, earned commissions are payable within thirty (30)days of when such amounts are collected by Company.
perturbation.changed_text: For a registered referral where the customer purchases directly from Company or another channel/contract vehicle other than Reseller, earned commissions are payable within fifteen (15)days of when such amounts are collected by Company.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a direct conflict with the earlier modified Section 6 and creates another payment inconsistency, by stating that commissions are payable within 15 days, different from both previous values, further obfuscating the payment deadline.

perturbation.original_text: Contract is renewable for 1 year extension by amendment to this agreement. Either Party may terminate this agreement for non-cause with a sixty (60) written notice.
perturbation.changed_text: Contract is renewable for 1 year extension by amendment to this agreement. Either Party may terminate this agreement for non-cause with a thirty (30) written notice.
perturbation.explanation: This perturbation creates a contradiction regarding the termination notice period. The preamble initially states a 60-day notice, but this change reduces it to 30 days, leading to confusion about the required notice duration for termination without cause.
